page.title: 05Weymouth Carnival.
page.content: Every year,during August,Weymouth holds a day-long{Carnival.}Its origins date back to 1318 in a charter granted by Edward II. Today the event is organised by Weymouth Round Table.All proceeds are donated to local charities.In 1984,Â£58 000 was counted in on Carnival Day. Sideshows,stalls and funfair rides are put up on the Esplanade.Displays are given by the Red Arrows or other stunt flyers.Races are run along the Front-Barrel Rolling,Trolley Pushing and running.There are sandcastle competitions. The real highlight is the{Procession} ,when it can take over an hour for all the brightly decorated floats and lorries to pass by. The day ends with the darkness lit up by a{Firework Display}launched from a barge in the bay. Mark Croad.
